$UVXY $SPY $IWM $AAPL $MSFT - Just to tell you how utterly disconnected the market is from the economy. The economic data released this and last week was worse or far worse than expected. CPI, PPI, Consumer Sentiment, Personal Debt... markets did NOTHING. Today, retail was better than expected, NOTHING. When Jerome Bowell speaks, markets move. Were all retailers buying and selling in unison by the second? This market used to be fun to trade in.. now? It's Fed control. Bonds keep climbing, home builder confidence falls stocks aren't phased. This is the bubble the Fed created with their moronic QE and 0%. They've inflated the largest bubble in US history. Infinite QE, buying corporate bonds, lead to historic stock buy backs. Now? Their hands are tied. If they do nothing and keep rates at 0.1% and pumping QE, inflation will  turn into hyper-inflation. If they raise, it'll throw the US into recession and they'll prick their own bubble. Either way by summer, we will feel the pain. Watch!

Zynga ($ZNGA) could see an extended FTC antitrust review of its planned $12.7B sale to Take-Two Interactive ($TTWO). 
The U.S. Federal Trade Commission may look at pursuing "creative approaches" to the antitrust review, which could lead to a longer timeline, according to a CTFN report, which cited a source. Take-Two is said to be confident that it's on path to get all necessary regulatory approvals. 
 
The Zynga deal seemed to usher in a spate of deals in the video game sector including Microsoft's ($MSFT) planned almost $70B purchase of Activision ($ATVI) and Sony's ($SONY) deal to acquire 'Halo'/'Destiny' developer Bungie in $3.6B deal. 
Take-Two management is said to believe that a review might be easier than others in the gaming industry since its focused on the crowded mobile gaming space rather than console games or virtual reality, according to the CTFN report. 
 
https://seekingalpha.com/news/3800942-zynga-may-see-extended-antitrust-review-of-planned-sale-to-take-two-report
